intro: Ascolepis metallorum, commonly known as the copperleaf, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking copper-colored leaves, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ascolepis metallorum produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by small, round fruits.
